analyzed: iddhi balena samannāgataḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya ati

original: Iddhimayiko so āyu, iddhimayikā sā gati, iddhimayiko so attabhāvappaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: iddhimayiko so āyu iddhimayikā sā gati iddhimayikaḥ so atta bhāva paṭilābho ti
translated: “Is that life-span made of supernormal power, is that destiny made of supernormal power, is that embodiment made of supernormal power?”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “That should not be said.”

analyzed: iddhi balena samannāgataḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “Is one who possesses the power of supernatural knowledge able to remain for an aeon?”

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “Yes.”

original: Atītaṁ kappaṁ tiṭṭheyya, anāgataṁ kappaṁ tiṭṭheyyāti?
analyzed: atītam kappam tiṭṭheyya anāgatam kappam tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “Would he remain for the past aeon, would he remain for the future aeon?”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “That should not be said.”

analyzed: iddhi balena samannāgataḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “Is one who possesses the power of supernatural knowledge able to remain for an aeon?”

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “Yes.”

original: Dve kappe tiṭṭheyya, tayo kappe tiṭṭheyya, cattāro kappe tiṭṭheyyāti?
analyzed: dve kappe tiṭṭheyya tayo kappe tiṭṭheyya cattāro kappe tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “Would he remain for two aeons, would he remain for three aeons, would he remain for four aeons?”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “That should not be said.”

analyzed: iddhi balena samannāgataḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “Is one who possesses the power of supernatural knowledge able to remain for an aeon?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Sati jīvite jīvitāvasese tiṭṭheyya, asati jīvite jīvitāvasese tiṭṭheyyāti?
analyzed: āmantā  sati jīvite jīvita avasese tiṭṭheyya asati jīvite jīvita avasese tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Would he remain as long as life remains, as long as life-breath remains?”

analyzed: sati jīvite jīvita avasese tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “He would remain as long as life remains, as long as life-breath remains.”

original: Hañci sati jīvite jīvitāvasese tiṭṭheyya, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci sati jīvite jīvita avasese tiṭṭheyya no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “If there is no life, no life remaining, would it be standing?”

analyzed: iddhi balena samannāgataḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “It would not be right to say that one possessing the power of supernormal power would stand for an eon.”

original: Asati jīvite jīvitāvasese tiṭṭheyyāti, mato tiṭṭheyya, kālaṅkato tiṭṭheyyāti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….
analyzed: asati jīvite jīvita avasese tiṭṭheyya ati mato tiṭṭheyya kālaṅkato tiṭṭheyya ati  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “If there is no life, no life remaining, would it be standing?” “Would it be standing when dead, when passed away?”

analyzed: iddhi balena samannāgataḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya ati  āmantā
translated: “It would not be right to say that one possessing the power of supernormal power would stand for an eon.”🔽“It would not be right to say that one possessing the power of supernormal power would stand for an eon.”

original: Uppanno phasso mā nirujjhīti labbhā iddhiyā paggahetunti?
analyzed: uppannaḥ phassaḥ mā nirujjhi iti labbhā iddhiyā paggahetunti
translated: “If contact that has arisen were to cease, would it be possible by supernormal power to make it not cease?”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe

analyzed: iddhi balena samannāgataḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya ati  āmantā

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe

analyzed: iddhi balena samannāgataḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “Is it possible by supernormal power to remain for an eon?”

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “Yes, friend.”

original: Jātidhammā sattā mā jāyiṁsūti labbhā iddhiyā paggahetunti?
analyzed: jāti dhammā sattā mā jāyisu iti labbhā iddhiyā paggahetunti
translated: “Is it possible by supernormal power to lay hold of the idea that beings subject to birth might not be born?”

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽jarādhammā sattā mā jīriṁsūti …pe…🔽byādhidhammā sattā mā byādhiyiṁsūti …pe…
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  jarā dhammā sattā mā pe  byādhi dhammā sattā mā pe
translated: “No, friend.”🔽“Is it possible by supernormal power to lay hold of the idea that beings subject to ageing might not age …🔽that beings subject to sickness might not fall sick …

original: maraṇadhammā sattā mā mīyiṁsūti labbhā iddhiyā paggahetunti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….
analyzed: maraṇa dhammā sattā mā mīyisu iti labbhā iddhiyā paggahetunti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: that beings subject to death might not die?”🔽“No, friend.”

translated: “Then you should not say

analyzed: iddhi balena samannāgataḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: that it is possible by supernormal power to remain for an eon.”

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “Yes, friend.”

analyzed: nanu vuttam bhagavatā
translated: But was it not said by the Blessed One:

original: “yassa kassaci, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, so ākaṅkhamāno kappaṁ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṁ vā”ti.
analyzed: yassa kassaci ānanda cattāro iddhipādāḥ bhāvitāḥ bahulīkatāḥ yā anīka tā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā su samāraddhā saḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ kappam vā tiṭṭheyya kappa avasesam vā ati
translated: ‘Ānanda, for one in whom the four roads to power have been developed, pursued, carried out, established, maintained, augmented, well-undertaken, and well-completed, if he so wished he could remain for an eon or for the remainder of an eon’?”

analyzed: atthā iva suttanto ti
translated: Is there a sutta to that effect?”

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “There is.”

original: Tena hi iddhibalena samannāgato kappaṁ tiṭṭheyyāti.
analyzed: tena hi iddhi balena samannāgataḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “Well then, one who has the power of supernormal power would live for an eon.”

analyzed: iddhi balena samannāgataḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “One who has the power of supernormal power would live for an eon?”

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “There is.”

analyzed: nanu vuttam bhagavatā
translated: “But hasn’t it been said by the Blessed One:

original: “catunnaṁ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṁ natthi koci pāṭibhogo samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṁ.
analyzed: catunna bhikkhave dhammānam natthi koci pāṭibhogaḥ samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā devaḥ vā māraḥ vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmi
translated: ‘There is no one—whether monastic or brahmin, whether god, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone else in the world—who can stop the four noble truths from arising.

analyzed: katamesam
translated: What are the four?

original: ‘Jarādhammo mā jīrī’ti natthi koci pāṭibhogo samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṁ.
analyzed: jarā dhammo mā jīri iti natthi koci pāṭibhogo samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā devaḥ vā māraḥ vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmi
translated: “‘One subject to old age should not grow old’—there is no one—whether monastic or brahmin, whether god, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone else in the world—who can stop this.

analyzed: byādhi dhammaḥ mā pe
translated: “‘One subject to sickness should not fall sick’ …

original: ‘maraṇadhammo mā mīyī’ti …pe…🔽yāni kho pana tāni pubbe katāni pāpakāni kammāni saṅkilesikāni ponobbhavikāni sadarāni
analyzed: maraṇa dhammaḥ mā mīyi iti pe  yāni kho pana tāni pubbe katāni pāpakāni kammāni saṅkilesikāni ponobbhavikāni sa darāni
translated: “‘One subject to death should not die’ …🔽“‘One who has previously done bad deeds should not experience their results’—there is no one—whether monastic or brahmin, whether god, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone else in the world—who can stop this.

original: dukkhavipākāni āyatiṁ jātijarāmaraṇiyāni, ‘tesaṁ vipāko mā nibbattī’ti natthi koci
analyzed: dukkha vipākāni āyatim jāti jarā maraṇiyāni tesam vipākaḥ mā nibbatti iti natthi koci
translated: “‘The results of bad deeds that I have previously done and that are ripening in the present should not ripen’—there is no one—whether monastic or brahmin, whether god, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone else in the world—who can stop this.

original: pāṭibhogo samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṁ.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā devaḥ vā māraḥ vā brahmā vā
translated: there is no ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or anyone else in the world who can rightly accuse me, saying:

original: Imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, catunnaṁ dhammānaṁ natthi koci pāṭibhogo samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmin”ti.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave catunnam dhammānam natthi koci pāṭibhogaḥ samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā devaḥ vā māraḥ vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmin ti
translated: There is no ascetic or brahmin, god, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone in the world who can stand up to these four things.”

analyzed: atthā iva suttanto ti
translated: Is there a sutta on this?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “There is.”

analyzed: tena hi na vattabba
translated: “Well then, you shouldn’t say this.”

analyzed: iddhi balena samannāgataḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “The Buddha, who possesses the power of supernormal power, could have stayed for the world-cycle.”

analyzed: iddhi bala kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of the power of supernormal power is finished.
